text:
A penumbral eclipse of the Moon will occur on Wednesday.

In Chennai, the moon will rise as an eclipsed one at 6.19 p.m.

According to P. Iyamperumal, executive director, Periyar Science and Technology Centre, Chennai, the eclipse will begin at 3.09 p.m. and end at 7.24 p.m.

The moon will darken slightly and not completely as only a very light shadow of the earth will fall on the moon surface.

Lunar eclipses occur when the moon moves into the shadow of the earth.

It takes place only on full moon days, when the moon is diametrically opposite to the position of the sun, as viewed from the earth, Mr. Iyamperumal added.
title: Lunar eclipse can be witnessed in city today
